Articles.Content: Hi, so I saw the game on Xbox one a little while ago and I just went to buy it because I love watching the game, but it is not there, I even searched Kerbal Space Program and I can't find it. So I was wondering if it was taken down from console or what?

Greetings @Firefighterboy and welcome to the forums.

The company originally contracted with the port made a complete mess of it so the task has been passed on to another company.

Quote

 "An updated version of KSP for consoles will be available by the end of January 2018".

As said above, the console ports were... less than successful so they were removed from the console stores, see the post below for a few more details:

On 24/07/2017 at 12:06 AM, Gaarst said:

The console ports were disastrous. A patch was made to solve the main issues and I don't think it solved anything because nothing seemed to have changed.

The company that made the ports (Flying Tiger Entertainment) was fired by Squad after this mess, and a new one (Blitworks) was hired to re-do the ports from scratch. In the meantime the console versions were pulled from the Xbox and PS4 stores and will come back once the new port is done.

It's been a few months now. The new ports get their two lines of "we're working on it and we're getting closer to the end" in each Devnotes KSP Weeklies and that's pretty much it.

 

Don't worry about the current console ports, you're not missing much considering the feedback they received.

 

Note that we were just given a "release date" for the console redone ports last week:

On 03/11/2017 at 9:45 PM, SQUAD said:

The updated console version of KSP will be available by the end of January 2018, on both PS4 and Xbox One. [...] We took the decision to build these new versions from the ground up, which has taken more time than we had hoped,

 

Edited November 10, 2017 by Gaarst
